subproject.description: The objective of this project is to cooperate, through technical support to the Ministry of Environment, to implement the provisions of the Convention on Biological Diversity, the Convention on Wetlands of International Importance and the Brazilian Antarctic Program and promote synergy between the Convention on Biological Diversity, UN Convention to Combat Desertification and Mitigating the Effects of Drought and the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change. The project will achieve this through the following 3 Outcomes and their related Outputs: (i) Develop mechanisms and tools for implementation of the Convention on Biological Diversity and monitoring the implementation of the National Biodiversity Policy, (ii) Develop mechanisms and tools for implementing the goals, rights and commitments made by Brazil to the ratification of international agreements related to biosafety and genetic diversity, (iii) Designing technical capacity in MMA for planning and integrated public policies and programs to the guidelines of the Convention on Biological Diversity and Convention on Wetlands of International Importance, (iv) Develop mechanisms and instruments for the fulfillment of commitments of environmental commitments under the Antarctic Treaty System, (v) Designing mechanisms and instruments for the promotion of synergies between the Convention on Biological Diversity, UN Convention to Combat Desertification and Mitigating the Effects of Drought and the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change, aimed at combating desertification and mitigation and adaptation to the effects of climate change in the Caatinga biome, including transition areas with the Cerrado and (vi) Perform mid-term evaluation and final evaluation of project execution watching the relevance, efficiency, effectiveness and sustainability of results and products by checking the fulfillment of the objectives and scope thereof.
